title: Gracefully handle missing headers
body:
Reports a missing header rejection only if the header's decoder didn't return a default value.

I've also added a regression test by using Cookie as an example: missing Cookie should be treated in the same way as empty Cookie header, but before this PR would reject the entire request. Now it's going to be handled correctly.

Closes #1781.

title: `#[must_use]` all the things!

labels.name: C-enhancement
labels.description: Category: A PR with an enhancement

body: This adds `#[must_use]` to all response types, `Router`, `MethodRouter`, and middleware. If you make one of those and don't use it, it's probably a bug. Its probably mostly an issue in handlers where things need to be returned to be converted into responses.

title: Implement `Clone` for `CookieJar`, `PrivateCookieJar` and `SignedCookieJar`

labels.name: C-enhancement
labels.description: Category: A PR with an enhancement

body:
## Motivation

Derive `Clone` missing from `CookieJar`.

## Solution

Add `Clone` to `CookieJar`

body: https://github.com/tokio-rs/axum/pull/1800#discussion_r1124189669

title: Fix routing issues when loading a `Router` via a dynamic library
body:
Fixes https://github.com/tokio-rs/axum/issues/1803

I also tested it with the repro script and does indeed fix the problem.

title: Fixed small typo
body:
## Motivation
``` rust
async fn handler(Path(p): Path<i32>) -> String {
    format!("{p}")
}
```
The above handler returns:

Invalid URL: Cannot parse value at index 0 with value "123123123123123" to a **i16**

It should return:

Invalid URL: Cannot parse value at index 0 with value "123123123123123" to a **i32**

title: Remove remnants of spa feature

labels.name: breaking change
labels.description: A PR that makes a breaking change.

body:
## Motivation

I saw that `SpaRouter` was removed in #1784, but the `spa` feature flag was still referenced in a few places, including doc comments.

## Solution

I cleaned up the remnants of the `spa` feature flag that I could find.

title: Replace weird doc paragraph by compiler-checked must_use attribute
body: Very lazy fix for making it harder to accidentally discard the `Response` generated by `WebSocketUpgrade::on_upgrade`. Feel free to improve by prodiving a message (`#[must_use = "message"]` or restoring a more useful version of the docs I deleted.

title: Document the fact that `debug_handler` doesn't work within impl blocks
body:
<!--
Thank you for your Pull Request. Please provide a description above and review
the requirements below.

Bug fixes and new features should include tests.

Contributors guide: https://github.com/tokio-rs/axum/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md
-->

## Motivation

When upgrading from from axum 0.5.x to 0.6.x I encountered a breaking change to how the `debug_handler` macro works. 

In 0.5.x, an associated function (not a method) could be used with `debug_handler`. In 0.6.x this yields confusing compilation errors. 

As per @davidpdrsn on Discord: 

> ah yes I see why now. Basically in 0.6 FromRequest got a new (secret) type param M, which is used to work around some otherwise overlapping impls. But because of this we need to generate slightly different code in debug_handler, which doesn't work we're inside an impl would be good to document. 

## Solution

This PR attempts to document this behavior.

<!--
Summarize the solution and provide any necessary context needed to understand
the code change.
-->

title: Add special handling of `FromRequest` extractors not being the last arg
body:
In the case a known `FromRequest` extractor isn't the last argument
`#[debug_handler]` will now give a more precise error.

title: Update documentation for `FailedToDeserializeQueryString` response type
body:
I believe this was just an oversight from #1387.

Changes the stated return type from `422 Unprocessable Entity` to `400 Bad Request`.

title: Add example showing how to run axum on hyper 1.0
body: This weekend I've been working on [tower-hyper-http-body-compat](https://crates.io/crates/tower-hyper-http-body-compat) which provides adapters between hyper 1.0, tower-service 0.3, and http-body 0.4. That allows you to easily run an axum app on hyper 1.0.

title: Use `JsonRejection::{status, body_text}` in customize extractor error example
body: I think we should recommend people use these methods. Its simpler and likely to be more correct, or at least match what axum's built-in extractors do.

title: update tokio dep to fix potential security vulnerability
body:
Update tokio version to fix potential security vulnerability.

https://deps.rs/crate/axum/0.6.8

title: docs: Clarify that state parameters need to come before body too
body:
<!--
Thank you for your Pull Request. Please provide a description above and review
the requirements below.

Bug fixes and new features should include tests.

Contributors guide: https://github.com/tokio-rs/axum/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md
-->

## Motivation

I used `axum` for the first time recently. I had a `state` parameter after `body` and got an inscrutable compile error (that I wrongly assumed was because of my complex return type) and it took me a good while to figure out what was wrong.

## Solution

I had read the section about order of extractors but in my mental model state wasn't extracting anything from the request. 

Mentioning it explicitly like I did in this PR would have helped me, and potentially others in the future.

body: Infallible ServeDir is just so much nicer 🎉

title: Add hint for on further details for WebSocket
body:
## Motivation

I actually had a hard time figuring out the `WebSocket` API. I noticed in the examples that `split` is used and was going to leave a reference to it in the documentation.

While editing `ws.rs`, I noticed other mentions of `split` and finally noticed that there was more documentation on the `WebSocket` in the module level docs.

## Solution

Leave a hint on where to find more information for the `WebSocket`. Hopefully this'll help the next lost soul find their way around better.

title: Remove `B` type param: the rest
body: It should all compile now 🤞

title: Remove `B` type param: rest of axum
Remove `B` type param: axum-extra
body: Just mechanical changes.

title: Remove `B` type param: `Router`, `MethodRouter`, `Handler`
body: These are the interesting parts of axum. The rest is fairly trivial so I'll do a separate PR for those.

title: Fix missing `Allow` when middleware are applied to `MethodRouter`
body:
Fixes https://github.com/tokio-rs/axum/issues/1770

To be totally honest I don't understand why this fixes the issue. I also noticed some weirdness in this piece of the code in https://github.com/tokio-rs/axum/pull/1711/files#r1082406463. Removing it doesn't seem to break anything else, and the bug it was originally added to fix doesn't occur anymore.

The reason its pretty hard to follow I think is that we wrap things in `Route` quite a bit, which also wraps the response future in `RouteFuture`. So there are several layers of `RouteFuture` being called and previously mutating the response.

title: Remove `B` type param: axum-core
body:
This is the next step in removing the `B` type param as outlined in https://github.com/tokio-rs/axum/pull/1751. This PR updates axum-core.

The changes are entirely mechanical. Stop using `Request<B>` and use `Request<axum_core::body::Body>` instead.

I think a `type Request<B = axum_core::body::Body> = http::Request<B>` alias would also be nice, similarly to what we have for `Response`. I'll probably add that when https://github.com/tokio-rs/axum/pull/1751 is merged.

title: Add deaftone
body: Add deaftone to ecosystem

title: Add `MockConnectInfo`

labels.name: C-enhancement
labels.description: Category: A PR with an enhancement

body:
Using the `ConnectInfo` extractor during tests was a little tricky. You can't just call `Router::into_make_service_with_connect_info` and then send it requests, because that produces a `MakeService` and not a `Service<Request>`.

The solution was to set `ConnectInfo` in an extension yourself however that relies on implementation details which feels bad.

This introduces `MockConnectInfo` which basically does the same thing but now with a proper API, so the implementation details are encapsulated.

title: Rename `ProtoBuf` to `Protobuf`

labels.name: breaking change
labels.description: A PR that makes a breaking change.

body: Re-opening https://github.com/tokio-rs/axum/pull/1595 because I accidentally merged it into the 0.7 branch. It only touches axum-extra so doesn't have to wait for axum 0.7.

labels.name: breaking change

body:
I don't think it was intentional to use `serde_json::Error` here and we don't generally use that elsewhere we do JSON things.

Discovered this with <https://github.com/davidpdrsn/cargo-public-api-crates>

body: Its a little [cargo command](https://github.com/davidpdrsn/cargo-public-api-crates) I'm experimenting with. Something I've wanted for a while. I wanna give it a shot here and see how its working.

title: Add shared mutable state documentation
body:
## Motivation
I spent a lot of time trying to find documentation for creating a mutable state. I eventually found discussion #629 

## Solution

Added documentation for creating mutable state and wrote a small trivial example using a `Vec<String>`

title: Add `Body::from_stream`
body:
Inspired by hyper's `Body::wrap_stream`.

With this we can remove [`StreamBody`](https://docs.rs/axum/latest/axum/body/struct.StreamBody.html) but I think I'll do that in another PR as it impacts things like `AsyncReadBody`.

Maybe we could also add `Body::from_async_read`? Though that'd require axum-core to depend on tokio-util 🤔

title: [Fix] Allow `clone_on_copy` for `FromRef`
body:
There was a clippy warning if you derived a struct with `FromRef` that contains a type that derives `Copy` 

## Solution

As suggested in the issue, I added `#[allow(clippy::clone_on_copy)]` to the macro output

Fixes: #1737

body: Breaking change because its in axum-extra's public API.

body:
Changelogs:

- https://github.com/jplatte/serde_html_form/blob/main/CHANGELOG.md#020
- base64 doesn't have one

title: Avoid unnecessary clones of state in MethodRouter
body:
<!--
Thank you for your Pull Request. Please provide a description above and review
the requirements below.

Bug fixes and new features should include tests.

Contributors guide: https://github.com/tokio-rs/axum/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md
-->

## Motivation

<!--
Explain the context and why you're making that change. What is the problem
you're trying to solve? If a new feature is being added, describe the intended
use case that feature fulfills.
-->

I noticed that a state type was getting cloned a lot more than I expected it to be on a server with just two endpoints. This turned out to be due to MethodRouter cloning the state for every single possible method endpoint, even those which didn't exist. Since it's relatively uncommon for every single route to have a handler for every single HTTP method, this is just wasted work.

Of course generally state will be wrapped in something like an Arc, so the amount of wasted work will be small, but reducing the number of clones is easy enough to justify here I think.

## Solution

<!--
Summarize the solution and provide any necessary context needed to understand
the code change.
-->
MethodEndpoint is private, so changing its with_state method to take a reference it can clone lazily is easy and not a breaking change. This still results in 4 clones for 2 endpoints (one for each MethodRouter, and one for each MethodEndpoint), but that's much better than the 18 I was seeing previously

title: Add `TypedPath::with_query_params`
body: Fixes https://github.com/tokio-rs/axum/issues/1740

title: Document gotchas with `impl IntoResponse`
body:
We sometimes hear from people who are confused by why `impl IntoResponse` doesn't work.

Figured it makes sense to document. That way we can link to this when we get questions about it :P

title: Support passing `MethodRouter` to `Router::fallback`
body:
Fixes #1645

This implements `Handler` for `MethodRouter` which enables passing it to `Router::fallback` even if the `MethodRouter` requires state.

This also enables doing `get(get(handler))` which is odd but I doubt anyone would do that by accident. I'm not sure if it could lead to other issues.

title: Add `KeepAlive::event`
body:
Fixes https://github.com/tokio-rs/axum/issues/1728

@markuskobler what do you think about this?

body: Should fix https://github.com/tokio-rs/axum/issues/1718

body: A small refactoring we can do now that our MSRV supports `Iterator::map_while`

title: Document required tokio features for example
body: Fixes https://github.com/tokio-rs/axum/issues/1714

title: Add `RawPathParams`
body: For library authors that are building on top of axum it might be useful to get the raw path parameters, without deserializing, and thus saving some allocations.

title: Implement `Clone` and `Service` for `Next`
body: Figured we might as well implement these.

title: Use call-site span for future Send check in debug_handler
body: Fixes #1707. It would be nice if we could make the compiler not emit the "due to this bound" note at all, maybe with an empty span? I think that existed at some point, but was removed from the nightly [Span API](https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/54725).

title: Use implicit format-args captures where applicable
Fix some comments in websockets example
body: A few comments in the websockets example weren't complete. A few had trivial typos. And one comment change with a gender-neutral seems to be more idiomatic with tokio comments.

title: Update to tonic 0.8
body:
## Motivation

Updates tonic to the latest version.

## Solution

Updates crates related to tonic.

title: Simpify `parse-body-based-on-content-type` example
body: I think it might be confusing to use an enum because then you have to `match` in the handler. Most of the time you'd probably wanna use a struct so the handler doesn't have to care about the `content-type`.

title: Add `option_layer`
body:
Tower already has `option_layer` for conditionally applying a `Layer` but since it uses `tower::util::Either` it always changes the error type to `BoxError`. That requires using `HandleErrorLayer` which is inconvenient for axum users.

That has been changed in tower
(https://github.com/tower-rs/tower/pull/637) but still has some issues (https://github.com/tower-rs/tower/issues/665). Its also a breaking change so hasn't been released yet.

In the meantime I figure we can provide our own thing in axum-extra, since we already have an `Either` type there.

title: Add internal macro to make tests of `nest` easier to write
body:
This might be considered a dirty hack but stick with me.

There have been talk about changing `nest` back to how it worked in 0.5, where it would "flatten" the routes into the outer router. That should fix the [performance regression](https://github.com/tokio-rs/axum/issues/1624) and the [`MatchedPath` issues](https://github.com/tokio-rs/axum/issues/1441) people have reported.

However the reason I change `nest` in 0.6 to just call `nest_service` was to more the subtle differences between the two methods. So if we're gonna back I wanna make sure we aren't introducing new differences.

One way to do that is for each test that uses `nest`, write the same test but use `nest_service`. That obviously kinda tedious to do manually but easy to do in a macro. So this PR adds such a macro.

title: Support `deserialize_any` for `Path`
body:
Forwarding to `deserialize_str` is probably gonna do the correct thing in most cases. It is also what `serde_urlencoded` does for values (https://github.com/nox/serde_urlencoded/blob/master/src/de.rs#L194-L202)

Fixes https://github.com/tokio-rs/axum/issues/1678

title: Add `axum_extra::extract::Multipart`
body:
It is is similar to `axum::extract::Multipart` except that it enforces field exclusivity at runtime instead of compile time.

I kinda wish we didn't have to do it honestly. Tracking lifetimes at compile feels much more correct but we've learned that it causes lots of headaches, especially because `Field` not being `'static`.

I'm thinking for 0.7 we can move this into axum but keep it in axum-extra in the meantime.

title: Implement `IntoResponse` for `[u8; N]` and `&'static [u8; N]` (#1690)
body:
## Motivation

I was trying to return an include_bytes! and axum doesn't actually have IntoResponse for its return type

## Solution

Implement IntoResponse for `&'static [u8; N]` and (inefficiently) for `[u8; N]`.

title: Release axum, axum-core, and axum-macros
body: Someone on Discord needs the new `body_text` and `status` methods to lets :shipit:

title: Replace `actions-rs/toolchain@v1` with stable alternative
body: `actions-rs/toolchain@v1` is unmaintained (https://github.com/actions-rs/toolchain/issues/216). This replaces it with `dtolnay/rust-toolchain@stable`

title: Document breaking changes related to `nest`
body: Fixes https://github.com/tokio-rs/axum/issues/1669

title: Use `422 Unprocessable Entity` for `Form` deserialization errors, except `GET` and `HEAD` requests
body:
For `GET` and `HEAD` requests `Form` should use `400 Bad Request` (`422` is only for request bodies).

Fixes https://github.com/tokio-rs/axum/issues/1680

## TODO

- [x] Changelog
- [x] Update docs for `Form` to mention that it handles both query and body params.

title: Fix warnings for cloning references in generated code
body:
## Motivation

In #1674, it was pointed out that `axum-macros` causes some `clippy` warnings (and some `rustc` lints to fail) as the `FromRef` macro generates code which clones reference types unnecessarily.

## Solution

This seems to be when generating the body of the trait implementation, but since we have the type information from `syn` at that point it's relatively simple to resolve these.

This change:
* Avoids using `.clone` if we are generating the implementation for a reference type field
* Adds a simple UI test to ensure this compiles with the `rustc` lint set to deny

Fixes #1674.

title: Enable the runtime feature of hyper when using tokio
body:
## Motivation

Currently axum never enables the `runtime` feature of hyper, which gates functions like [`Server::http1_header_read_timeout`](https://docs.rs/hyper/latest/hyper/server/struct.Builder.html#method.http1_header_read_timeout)

## Solution

This makes axum enable the runtime `feature`. The alternative is to import hyper and enable the feature but then Rust Analyzer imports things from hyper instead of axum, which is very annoying.

title: add more comments to chat example
body:
## Motivation

As discussed with Programatik and Ferry on Discord, people have lots of
questions about the chat example, so some more code comments might be
helpful.

## Solution

As a new axum user myself (target audience of this example), I just tried to
express what I learned from carefully reading this example and implementing
something similar with slightly more words than before.  A particular focus was
on the spawned tasks (hopefully useful for readers not too familiar with async
rust yet).

This is an breaking API change. Merge for 0.7

Without this `Clone` implementation the compiler was showing errors on the `router.layer(middleware)` call. 

## Solution

Adding the `Clone` derive fixed the compiler error for me.

I've also removed an unnecessary `mut` keyword, that the compiler was warning about.

title: Updated websocket example to improve clarity and to be more distinct from chat example
body:
## Motivation

The web sockets example was not looking nice, it was not user-friendly at all (took a while to figure out what it was even supposed to be able to do). Furthermore, it was not actually showcasing anything about web sockets that the chat example did not already demonstrate better.  Either it had to go, or it had to be made more distinct, so I took the time to make it more "involved". 

## Solution

-  all parts of the example have received additional comments
- the sample webpage has received hints that the user should open browser's console to see messages (it was just blank)
- added a Python script that demonstrates some more tricky features such as ping/pong handling, and allows to quickly connect with multiple "users" to the test server
- added the logic to push unsolicited messages to the client form the server (which is not obvious at all though easy to actually do)
- added comments explaining that one should not try to implement pong responder (as axum already has one builtin, and thus even though you can see the ping messages, you should not actually respond to them)

title: Change casing of ProtoBuf to Protobuf

labels.name: breaking change
labels.description: A PR that makes a breaking change.

body:
The casing "Protobuf" is canonical. Note the lowercase "b". The [protocolbuffers/protobuf](https://github.com/protocolbuffers/protobuf) repo uses this casing exclusively.

Examples:
- [Protobuf.java](https://github.com/protocolbuffers/protobuf/blob/7c308c7d45996e9d890623d80636319b292b84bc/java/core/src/main/java/com/google/protobuf/Protobuf.java#L45)
- [protobuf.rb](https://github.com/protocolbuffers/protobuf/blob/7c308c7d45996e9d890623d80636319b292b84bc/ruby/lib/google/protobuf.rb#L37)

This PR replaces all references of "ProtoBuf" to be "Protobuf".

- 36 substitions in *axum-extra/src/protobuf.rs*
- 1 substition in *axum-extra/src/lib.rs*
- one untouched casing of "Protobuf" in *ECOSYSTEM.md*
